CatDescriptText: Mr. C. Hines, 2535 Chauncey Drive, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 24, 1957, pg. 2 with question: "Does Pittsburgh Need Negro Police Inspectors?" answer reads: "Yes, Pittsburgh needs Negro police inspectors. Since the town is growing up in other ways, it should grow up in the promotion of Negroes on the police force."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of C. Hines, wearing dark plaid suit, two toned woven belt, and loosened floral tie with wrench shaped tie bar, standing in front of brick wall and window with venetian blind
